author: Redranchero
title: Nice polybag!
review:
This is a nice little set, it was a gift with lego.com purchases at one point, but I got it in a supermarket for £3.50 ($4.25) 

The Building Experience

This was an alright build, nothing too exciting, but that's what I expected for such a small set.

Minifigures

This set has 2 minifigs (with kid legs) both with rucksacks and the same legs (I don't mind, I quite like the colour!) the torsos are nice, but not unique to this set. One of them has a helmet, but the set incudes an extra hair piece for him. There is also a green frog and a skateboard, as well as an apple.

Builds

The builds are a roundabout and a skateboard ramp. The roundabout can fit the 2 minifigs and spins nicely, it looks fine, but it can be hard to tell what it is. The skateboard ramp also looks good, with a lamp, fountain and flowerbed in the back. The skateboard doesn't quite fit on the ramp (hence the low playability rating) and takes up most of it.

Overall

This is a good set, but not without issues. I rate it 8/10, mainly because it was a free gift a while back and for the price I bought it for it was good value. The minifigs are probably the best part of this for most people, but the builds are nice for a park scene, especially when combined with other sets.
